results.title: Is It a Meal? A Snack? No, It’s ‘Girl Dinner.’
results.abstract: Women across TikTok are showing off their suppers — snack plates made by one person, for the consumption and enjoyment of one person.

results.adx_keywords: Doctors;Refugees and Displaced Persons;Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Labor and Jobs;National Health Service;Great Britain
results.title: In Ukraine, They’re Doctors; in Britain, They’re Unemployed
results.abstract: Often jobless or languishing in low-skilled posts, doctors who fled Russia’s invasion are forced to confront a difficult dilemma: see their skills go unused, or return to a country at war.

media.caption: Dr. Samer al-Sheikh, with his daughter Dalia, at their home in Earl’s Court, London, in May. He has been applying for jobs and taking courses to try to find work in Britain.
media.copyright: Mary Turner for The New York Times

results.title: How to Write Music for Rolling Boulders
results.abstract: From “Indiana Jones” to “Star Wars,” you know John Williams’s movie themes. But some of his best music has barely been heard.

results.title: A Doomsaying Theory Enters Pop Culture

results.title: He Worked for Years to Overturn Affirmative Action and Finally Won. He’s Not Done.
results.abstract: Edward Blum’s latest victory at the Supreme Court is the culmination of a long fight to take race out of college admissions. Is the workplace next?

media.caption: Edward Blum calls himself a “matchmaker,” finding plaintiffs and pairing them with lawyers in an effort to remove race-conscious policies from American life.

results.title: Alone in an Empty House, Female Real Estate Agents Face Danger
results.abstract: Most sexual harassment comes from potential clients, and agents say they are vulnerable to abuse in an industry that offers few protections.

media.caption: Fearing the dangers of her job, Dawna Hetzler learned to use a gun. When she was alone at an open house and a buyer pulled a knife on her, she used it.

results.title: Twitter Sues Law Firm Over $90 Million Payment in Elon Musk Deal
results.abstract: The lawsuit targeted Wachtell, Lipton, Rosen & Katz, a well-known Wall Street law firm, for “unjust enrichment” related to Mr. Musk’s $44 billion purchase of Twitter.

results.title: Why China Has a Giant Pile of Debt
results.abstract: A major lender abroad, China is facing a debt bomb at home: trillions of dollars owed by local governments, their financial affiliates, and real estate developers.

media.caption: During her visit to Beijing, Treasury secretary Janet L. Yellen, seen here meeting with Chinese Premier Li Qiang, has tried to persuade China to cooperate more to address the debt crisis in lower-income countries.

results.title: Hunter Biden’s Daughter and a Tale of Two Families
results.abstract: The story surrounding the president’s grandchild in Arkansas, who has not yet met her father or her grandfather, is about money, corrosive politics and what it means to have the Biden birthright.

media.caption: Lunden Roberts posted photos of her daughter during a trip to Washington on Instagram. DNA testing established that the girl’s father is Hunter Biden, but she has yet to meet him or President Biden.
